title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 298/2000 of 8 February 2000 amending Regulation (EC) No 2190/96 on detailed rules for implementing Council Regulation (EC) No 2200/96 as regards export refunds on fruit and vegetables
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 298/2000
of 8 February 2000
amending Regulation (EC) No 2190/96 on detailed rules for implementing Council Regulation (EC) No 2200/96 as regards export refunds on fruit and vegetables
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Council Regulation (EC) No 2200/96 of 28 October 1996 on the common organisation of the market in fruit and vegetables(1), as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1257/1999(2), and in particular Article 35(11) thereof,
Whereas:
(1) Commission Regulation (EC) No 2190/96(3), as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1303/1999(4), lays down detailed rules for the application of Regulation (EC) No 2200/96 as regards export refunds on fruit and vegetables.
(2) As for other destinations, a limit should be placed on the period of validity of licences for the export of apples to Sri Lanka.
(3) The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the Management Committee for Fruit and Vegetables,
main_body: In the second subparagraph of Article 4(5) and the third subparagraph of Article 5(1) of Regulation (EC) No 2190/96, the words "Costa Rica and Japan" are replaced by the words "Costa Rica, Japan and Sri Lanka".

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 February 2000.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 297, 21.11.1996, p. 1.
(2) OJ L 160, 26.6.1999, p. 80.
(3) OJ L 292, 15.11.1996, p. 12.
(4) OJ L 155, 22.6.1999, p. 29.
